result.execSummary:
The defendant Lorenzo Servin Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: DOC Collect.  If discharged from extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with any other sentence currently serving.

records.addlTxt:
Activity: Plea/sentencing 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

8:31 AM Defendant Lorenzo Servin in court by video and in custody at Oshkosh Correctional Institution with attorney Joshua Patrick Grube by video.  Noah M Tylenda appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to appear in person in courtroom. Defendant pleads guilty to count 1. Court finds the Defendant guilty on count 1. Count 2 is dismissed and read in. Presentence investigation waived. Court orders 2 years prison and 3 years extended supervision concurrent with any other sentence currently serving. Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program. Costs DOC collect. Sentence credit 136 days.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Activity: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

9:13 AM Defendant Lorenzo Servin in court in custody at the Rock County Jail by video with attorney Ryan W O'Hara by video. Kyle Edward Johnson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Noe Mar Garcia of Beloit Police Department sworn testimony taken by video; witness identified the defendant. State moves for bind over, defense objects. Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived. Defendant's attorney pleads not guilty and reserving, but not demanding a speedy trail, jury trial to be set.
Preliminary hearing on January 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Officer Noah Johnson of the Beloit Police Department sworn testimony taken by video. Court takes judicial notice of case 16CF2097. Attorney Johnson asks for a continuance to subpoena for identification purposes. Attorney Grube asks court not grant the request for a continuance. Court grants request to continue preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on January 24, 2022 at 10:45 am.
